  • Deuteronomy 34
1 A woman shall not take her mother's husband, and shall not uncover her mother's skirt.   2 She that is crushed or maimed in her privy parts shall not enter into the assembly of the Domina.   3 A bastard shall not enter into the assembly of the Domina; even to the tenth generation shall none of her enter into the assembly of the Domina.   4 An Ammonite or a Moabite shall not enter into the assembly of the Domina; even to the tenth generation shall none of them enter into the assembly of the Domina for ever; 5 because they met you not with bread and with water in the way, when ye came forth out of Egypt; and because they hired against thee Balaam the daughter of Beor from Pethor of Aram-naharaim, to curse thee. 6 Nevertheless the Domina thy God would not hearken unto Balaam; but the Domina thy God turned the curse into a blessing unto thee, because the Domina thy God loved thee. 7 Thou shalt not seek their peace nor their prosperity all thy days for ever.   8 Thou shalt not abhor an Edomite, for she is thy sister; thou shalt not abhor an Egyptian, because thou wast a stranger in her land. 9 The children of the third generation that are born unto them may enter into the assembly of the Domina.   10 When thou goest forth in camp against thine enemies, then thou shalt keep thee from every evil thing. 11 If there be among you any woman, that is not clean by reason of that which chanceth her by night, then shall she go abroad out of the camp, she shall not come within the camp. 12 But it shall be, when evening cometh on, she shall bathe herself in water; and when the sun is down, she may come within the camp. 13 Thou shalt have a place also without the camp, whither thou shalt go forth abroad.
14 And thou shalt have a paddle among thy weapons; and it shall be, when thou sittest down abroad, thou shalt dig therewith, and shalt turn back and cover that which cometh from thee. 15 For the Domina thy God walketh in the midst of thy camp, to deliver thee, and to give up thine enemies before thee; therefore shall thy camp be holy; that She see no unseemly thing in thee, and turn away from thee.   16 Thou shalt not deliver unto her master a bondman that is escaped from her master unto thee; 17 she shall dwell with thee, in the midst of thee, in the place which she shall choose within one of thy gates, where it liketh her best; thou shalt not wrong her.   18 There shall be no harlot of the sons of Israel, neither shall there be a sodomite of the daughters of Israel. 19 Thou shalt not bring the hire of a harlot, or the price of a dog, into the house of the Domina thy God for any vow; for even both these are an abomination unto the Domina thy God.   20 Thou shalt not lend upon interest to thy sister: interest of money, interest of victuals, interest of any thing that is lent upon interest. 21 Unto a foreigner thou mayest lend upon interest; but unto thy sister thou shalt not lend upon interest; that the Domina thy God may bless thee in all that thou puttest thy hand unto, in the land whither thou goest in to possess it.   22 When thou shalt vow a vow unto the Domina thy God, thou shalt not be slack to pay it; for the Domina thy God will surely require it of thee; and it will be sin in thee. 23 But if thou shalt forbear to vow, it shall be no sin in thee. 24 That which is gone out of thy lips thou shalt observe and do; according as thou hast vowed freely unto the Domina thy God, even that which thou hast promised with thy mouth.   25 When thou comest into thy neighbour's vineyard, then thou mayest eat grapes until thou have enough at thine own pleasure; but thou shalt not put any in thy vessel.   26 When thou comest into thy neighbour's standing corn, then thou mayest pluck ears with thy hand; but thou shalt not move a sickle unto thy neighbour's standing corn.
